column5: Nothing huge but a couple nice perch.  Let a bunch go as well. The bite was on early in the morning and fell off a bit by 11 ish, so I called it a day. Ice was still about 14" thick but not in the best of shape near shore. Gaps could be forming near shore.
Nice going.  It would've been an amazing day on the ice.
and here the police are announcing everywhere that there is no safe ice on simcoe.......  they have no idea
Were you close to home? I seen someone out there today.  Nice feed.  Also noticed the Tiffen launch was melting away.Might be able to practice your launching by the weekend.LOL
nice !  Narrows are opening up nicely in Orillia a goOd 1 km or more Couch and beyond the channel markers on Simcoe . Won't be long  TB
Yummmy perch..  that looks like just enough for an afternoon snack
Yep, close to home indeed.  I had some big minnows on for pike as well and had something hit it but it didn't stick around.  Pulled up and no minnow.

Yes. Having said that I was also drop shotting with micro tubes on the same line as the minnow and it was about 50/50.  When the bite was on early the tubes were great but when it slowed the minnows worked much better. I ended up drillin 20 holes today and fished from 17' to 45'  and caught fish in every hole.
You,ll go blind fishing there.YA KNOW THAT RIGHT. l m a o   I would use my,,,,,,,,,,sorry,USE  minnows there too.

Great report and pic Cudz  It was a beautiful day to be out there and wish I could of taken the day off too Loads of fun when the perch come out to play and certainly a great meal for the pan! Good job and thanks for sharing Leechman
I decided to take the whole week off.  And yes Rob, I am enjoying my march break.
Oh god, that looks extremely tasty.
